Comiskey (i) So game 8 is at Comiskey, but there are games 3,4,5 also at Comiskey. Therefore, it's not the only game played there; there are others. Looking at the 'date' column: October 9 is only for game 8. So within that specific date, there's only one game. Therefore, it is the only game played at Comiskey Park (i) on October 9. Therefore, on that date, there's only one game at Comiskey Park (i), which is game 8. But the claim says "the only game play at Comiskey Park (i)", without specifying the date. So I need to check if any other games in the table are played at Comiskey Park (i). Looking through all games: - Game 3: October 3, Comiskey - Game 4: October 4, Comiskey - Game 5: October 6, Comiskey - Game 8: October 9, Comiskey So there are multiple games at Comiskey Park (i) on different dates. Therefore, the claim's statement that it's "the only game play" is incorrect because other games are also played there. Wait, but the claim says "on October 9, game 8...". So within that specific date and game, it's correct, but in general, Comiskey Park (i) hosts more than one game. However, the claim doesn't specify whether it's the only one on that day or overall. Looking back at the claim: It says "the only game play at Comiskey Park (i)". So is this referring to all time or just on October 9? If it's all time, then it's FALSE because other games are also there. If it's specifically on October 9, then maybe TRUE because that day only one game was there. But the way it's phrased: "the only game play at Comiskey Park (i)" without any date qualifier suggests it's making a general statement about all games at Comiskey Park (i), which is incorrect as there are multiple. Therefore, the claim is FALSE because other games were played there on different dates. Alternatively, if it's specifically referring to October 9, then perhaps the claim is TRUE because on that day, only game 8 was at Comiskey. However, the way it's phrased doesn't specify the date, so I think it's intended as a general statement, making it FALSE. Wait, but the claim says "on October 9, game 8", which is accurate, and then adds that it's "the only game play at Comiskey Park (i)". So perhaps within the context of October 9, it's TRUE because there was only one game that day. But as a general statement about all games at Comiskey, it's FALSE. But since the claim connects both statements: on Oct 9, game 8 happens and is the only game at Comiskey. Therefore, I think it's combining two facts. So to check the entire claim: - Is game 8 played on October 9? Yes. - Is it the only game at Comiskey on that date? Yes, because other games are on different dates. - Is it the only game at Comiskey overall? No, so this part is incorrect.
